title: China launches Sino-French astrophysics satellite, debris falls over populated area
summary: A Chinese launch of the joint Sino-French SVOM mission to study Gamma-ray bursts early Saturday saw toxic rocket debris fall over a populated area.

title: Synspective raises $44 million Series C round
summary: Japanese radar imaging company Synspective has raised 7 billion yen ($44 million) in a Series C round intended to fuel the expansion of its satellite constellation.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX swaps Falcon 9 boosters ahead of Starlink launch from Cape Canaveral
summary: SpaceX swapped out the Falcon 9 vehicle after a last-second abort at engine ignition during a launch attempt on June 14. Liftoff of the Starlink 10-2 mission is now scheduled  for 1:15 p.m. EDT (1715 UTC) on Sunday.

title: Starliner Mission Extended, All Systems Stable
summary: Boeing’s Starliner Crew Flight Test (CFT) has once more been extended, but everything remains stable and safe for the station, spacecraft, and crew. A new return date has yet to be determined, but it will be no earlier than early July.

title: NASA again delays Starliner undocking, return to Earth
summary: NASA and Boeing managers have again decided to extend the Starliner crew capsule's stay at the International Space Station, passing up a June 26 re-entry to allow more time for analysis and testing to make sure helium leaks and thruster failures are fully understood, officials said late Friday.

title: Starliner Return Delayed Yet Again
summary: Late today NASA said it is again delaying the return of the Boeing Starliner Crew Flight Test. Unlike the earlier schedule changes, no new date was announced. NASA and Boeing […]

title: NASA and Boeing Delay Starliner Return Again Again Again
summary: NASA and Boeing Delay Starliner Return Again Again Again

title: Starliner return delayed to July
summary: NASA and Boeing have pushed back the return of the CST-100 Starliner spacecraft from the International Space Station until at least early July to continue studies of propulsion system problems.

title: NASA indefinitely delays return of Starliner to review propulsion data
summary: “We are letting the data drive our decision."

title: Sols 4222-4224: A Particularly Prickly Power Puzzle
summary: Earth planning date: Friday, June 21, 2024 All our patient waiting has been rewarded, as we were greeted with the news that our drill attempt of “Mammoth Lakes 2” was successful!
